title: Indian Freedom Struggle
content:
# Indian Freedom Struggle

## Timeline of Major Events

### Pre-Congress Era (Before 1885)

| Year | Event |
|------|-------|
| 1857 | First War of Independence (Sepoy Mutiny) |
| 1867 | Prarthana Samaj founded |
| 1875 | Arya Samaj founded by Dayanand Saraswati |
| 1876 | Indian Association founded by Surendranath Banerjee |

## Revolt of 1857

### Causes
- Introduction of Enfield rifles (greased cartridges)
- Doctrine of Lapse
- Economic exploitation
- Social and religious grievances

### Key Leaders
| Leader | Region |
|--------|--------|
| Mangal Pandey | Barrackpore |
| Rani Lakshmibai | Jhansi |
| Tantia Tope | Kanpur |
| Nana Sahib | Kanpur |
| Bahadur Shah Zafar | Delhi |
| Kunwar Singh | Bihar |

### Result: Failure
- Company rule ended
- British Crown took over
- Queen's Proclamation 1858

## Indian National Congress (1885)

### Formation
- Founded: December 28, 1885
- Place: Bombay (Mumbai)
- Founder: A.O. Hume
- First President: W.C. Bonnerjee
- First Session: 72 delegates

### Moderate Phase (1885-1905)
**Leaders**: Dadabhai Naoroji, Gopal Krishna Gokhale, Surendranath Banerjee
**Methods**: Petitions, prayers, constitutional means

### Extremist Phase (1905-1919)
**Leaders**: Bal Gangadhar Tilak, Lala Lajpat Rai, Bipin Chandra Pal (Lal-Bal-Pal)
**Methods**: Boycott, Swadeshi, National Education

## Gandhi Era (1919-1947)

### Major Movements

| Movement | Year | Cause | Outcome |
|----------|------|-------|----------|
| Champaran | 1917 | Indigo farmers | First Satyagraha success |
| Kheda | 1918 | Peasant taxation | Partial success |
| Khilafat | 1919-24 | Support Muslims | Hindu-Muslim unity |
| Non-Cooperation | 1920-22 | Jallianwala Bagh | Suspended after Chauri Chaura |
| Civil Disobedience | 1930-34 | Salt Tax | Dandi March |
| Quit India | 1942 | British withdrawal | "Do or Die" |

### Important Dates
- **April 13, 1919**: Jallianwala Bagh Massacre
- **March 12, 1930**: Dandi March begins
- **August 8, 1942**: Quit India Movement
- **August 15, 1947**: Independence Day

## Revolutionary Movement

### Key Revolutionaries
| Name | Notable Act |
|------|-------------|
| Bhagat Singh | Lahore Conspiracy Case |
| Chandrashekhar Azad | Kakori Conspiracy |
| Subhash Chandra Bose | INA (Azad Hind Fauj) |
| Surya Sen | Chittagong Armoury Raid |
| Udham Singh | Killed Michael O'Dwyer |

title: Ancient Indian History
content:
# Ancient Indian History

## Indus Valley Civilization (3300-1300 BCE)

### Discovery
- Discovered: 1921-22
- First site: Harappa (1921)
- Discoverer: Dayaram Sahni
- Mohenjo-daro: R.D. Banerjee (1922)

### Important Sites
| Site | Location | Notable Features |
|------|----------|------------------|
| Harappa | Punjab, Pakistan | Granaries, coffin burial |
| Mohenjo-daro | Sindh, Pakistan | Great Bath, Granary |
| Lothal | Gujarat | Dockyard, Fire Altars |
| Kalibangan | Rajasthan | Fire Altars, Ploughed field |
| Dholavira | Gujarat | Water reservoirs |
| Rakhigarhi | Haryana | Largest Indian site |

### Features
- Urban planning with grid pattern
- Drainage system
- Standardized weights and measures
- Script (undeciphered)
- Bronze, copper tools

## Vedic Period (1500-600 BCE)

### Rig Vedic Period (1500-1000 BCE)
- Settled in Sapta Sindhu region
- Pastoral economy
- Indra most important deity
- Varna system based on occupation

### Later Vedic Period (1000-600 BCE)
- Agriculture dominant
- Settled in Ganga-Yamuna region
- Prajapati/Brahma important
- Varna became hereditary

### Four Vedas
| Veda | Content |
|------|----------|
| Rig Veda | Hymns to gods (oldest) |
| Sama Veda | Musical hymns |
| Yajur Veda | Sacrificial formulas |
| Atharva Veda | Spells, charms |

## Mahajanapadas (600-321 BCE)

### 16 Mahajanapadas
Important ones:
- **Magadha**: Most powerful (Capital: Rajagriha, later Pataliputra)
- **Kosala**: Ram's kingdom (Capital: Ayodhya)
- **Vatsa**: (Capital: Kaushambi)
- **Avanti**: (Capital: Ujjain)

## Maurya Empire (321-185 BCE)

### Important Rulers
| Ruler | Period | Achievements |
|-------|--------|---------------|
| Chandragupta | 321-298 BCE | Founded empire, defeated Seleucus |
| Bindusara | 298-273 BCE | Expanded south |
| Ashoka | 273-232 BCE | Kalinga War, Dhamma |

### Ashoka's Edicts
- Rock Edicts: 14 major
- Pillar Edicts: 7
- Script: Brahmi (mostly)
- Language: Prakrit

## Gupta Empire (320-550 CE)

### Golden Age of India
| Ruler | Achievements |
|-------|---------------|
| Chandragupta I | Founded dynasty |
| Samudragupta | Greatest conqueror |
| Chandragupta II | Vikramaditya, defeated Shakas |

### Achievements
- Aryabhatta (Mathematics, Astronomy)
- Kalidasa (Literature)
- Nalanda University
- Iron Pillar at Delhi

title: Medieval Indian History
content:
# Medieval Indian History

## Delhi Sultanate (1206-1526)

### Five Dynasties

| Dynasty | Period | Founder |
|---------|--------|----------|
| Slave/Mamluk | 1206-1290 | Qutub-ud-din Aibak |
| Khilji | 1290-1320 | Jalal-ud-din Khilji |
| Tughlaq | 1320-1414 | Ghiyas-ud-din Tughlaq |
| Sayyid | 1414-1451 | Khizr Khan |
| Lodi | 1451-1526 | Bahlul Lodi |

### Important Rulers

#### Qutub-ud-din Aibak (1206-1210)
- Started Qutub Minar
- Quwwat-ul-Islam Mosque
- Known as "Lakh Bakhsh"

#### Iltutmish (1211-1236)
- Completed Qutub Minar
- Introduced Iqta system
- First Delhi Sultan to issue coins

#### Razia Sultan (1236-1240)
- First woman ruler of Delhi
- Removed purdah
- Appointed Ethiopian Jamal-ud-din Yakut

#### Alauddin Khilji (1296-1316)
- Market reforms
- Defeated Mongols
- Conquered South India (Malik Kafur)

#### Muhammad bin Tughlaq (1325-1351)
- Shifted capital to Daulatabad
- Token currency experiment
- Ibn Battuta visited

## Mughal Empire (1526-1857)

### Major Rulers

| Ruler | Period | Achievement |
|-------|--------|-------------|
| Babur | 1526-1530 | Founded empire, Battle of Panipat |
| Humayun | 1530-1540, 1555-1556 | Lost to Sher Shah |
| Akbar | 1556-1605 | Din-i-Ilahi, Mansabdari |
| Jahangir | 1605-1627 | Chain of Justice |
| Shah Jahan | 1628-1658 | Taj Mahal, Red Fort |
| Aurangzeb | 1658-1707 | Maximum territory |

### Akbar's Administration
- Mansabdari System
- Din-i-Ilahi (religious policy)
- Navratnas (Nine Gems)
- Land Revenue: Todar Mal's Bandobast
- Abolished Jizya

### Architectural Achievements
| Monument | Builder | Location |
|----------|---------|----------|
| Qutub Minar | Iltutmish | Delhi |
| Humayun's Tomb | Akbar | Delhi |
| Fatehpur Sikri | Akbar | Agra |
| Taj Mahal | Shah Jahan | Agra |
| Red Fort | Shah Jahan | Delhi |
| Jama Masjid | Shah Jahan | Delhi |

## Maratha Empire

### Shivaji (1630-1680)
- Founded Maratha Kingdom
- Guerrilla warfare
- Coronation: 1674 at Raigad
- Ashtapradhan (Council of 8 Ministers)

### Important Peshwas
- Balaji Vishwanath
- Baji Rao I (greatest expansion)
- Balaji Baji Rao (Third Battle of Panipat, 1761)
